alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 8:34PM MST until August 15 at 1:30AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Chinle Creek in... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 130 AM MST. * At 831 PM MST, the public reported flash flooding in Chinle Creek from near Chinle north past Many Farms. This flood will continue northward this evening to near the Utah state line. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rock Point, Many Farms, Many Farms Lake and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... Highway 191 between mile markers 451 and 471...and between mile markers 493 and 500. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Chinle Wash, Chinle Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
